sentences.english: Why do you want to agree to have the dateline extended?
sentences.chinese: 你干嘛要答应把截止日延后呢？

sentences.english: Using the morning-after pill may delay your period by up to one week.
sentences.chinese: 服用事后避孕药可能使月经延后最多一个星期。

sentences.english: He decided to hold off going on vacation until he was less busy work.
sentences.chinese: 他决定延后到他的工作不忙时才度假。

sentences.english: The reason for South Africa's delay in informing the U. N. of its actions remains unclear.
sentences.chinese: 目前仍不清楚南非为何延后向联合国报告此次行动。

sentences.english: Phoenix International Airport, many flights taking off and landing are forced to delay or cancel.
sentences.chinese: 凤凰城国际机场许多起降班机都因此被迫延后或取消。

sentences.english: To make matters worse, the age when a woman can claim her State pension is being increased.
sentences.chinese: 更糟的是，能够领取国家养老金的女性年龄也在延后。

sentences.english: If this time is learning to climb on stage one after two months of delay, normal.
sentences.chinese: 若此时正是学爬阶段就后延后一两个月，正常的。

sentences.english: Mel:If you allow me that, and let me push back the start date one week.
sentences.chinese: 若你同意这点，并让开工日延后一周。

sentences.english: After you stop taking the pill, you may have only a two-week delay before you ovulate again.
sentences.chinese: 停用口服避孕药后，再次排卵可能延后二周左右。

sentences.english: I want to put off my plan to work in an animal hospital until next summer.
sentences.chinese: 我想把我在动物医院工作的计划延后到明年夏天。

sentences.english: Escalating regional tensions mean large-scale drilling may be slipping further into the future.
sentences.chinese: 由于地区紧张局势升级，大规模钻探开发可能延后。

sentences.english: I no longer want to postpone anything in life.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再把生命中的任何事延后。

sentences.english: After autumn, tomato cultural technique of covering plastic film is highly technical.
sentences.chinese: 大棚秋延后番茄栽培技术性强。

sentences.english: It is expected that they will postpone their holiday until their respective sports season have been completed.
sentences.chinese: 预估他们必须将假期延后到彼此的运动季结束之后。

definition: to push back (progress, the times etc)
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
ahead of schedule/sooner than planned/to bring forward (to an earlier time)
Yanchang county in Yan'an 延安[Yan2 an1], Shaanxi
to shift to an earlier date/to do sth ahead of time/in advance
to delay/to be held up/to miss (an opportunity)/delay/holdup
when the time comes/at the scheduled time
